alert.note: Alert for Colfax; Cuming; Stanton (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued December 15 at 3:25PM CST until December 15 at 4:00PM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: The National Weather Service in Omaha has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Cuming County in northeastern Nebraska... Northeastern Colfax County in northeastern Nebraska... Southeastern Stanton County in northeastern Nebraska... * Until 400 PM CST. * At 324 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Howells, or 23 miles northeast of Columbus, and a second area of rotation capable of producing a tornado near Leigh, both moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Beemer around 345 PM CST. Bancroft around 355 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include The Highway 9 And 51 Junction, 10 Miles West Of West Point and The Highway 15 And 32 Junction. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
